trans-unit.source: Identifies an element within the hierarchy of elements under a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref>.

Each page of an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document contains a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> element that defines its *content* in the form of positional text runs and graphics.

Through the use of document structure elements, pages of an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document can also be associated with <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> elements that define the *structure* of the page in the form of sections, paragraphs, lists, figures, and tables.
The NamedElement class is used to define the associations between content and structure parts of the document markup.

A NamedElement is the child of a structural element, such as a table cell or bullet list item that is located in the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> hierarchy of a page.
A NamedElement identifies an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> hierarchy of the same page.
The item it refers to is the content of the structural element.

For more information about structure elements of [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] documents, see Chapter 9 and Appendix E of the *XML Paper Specification (XPS)* available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=67000](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=67000).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.NamedElement"></xref> class.

Gets or sets the name of the element in the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> markup hierarchy that provides the content for the parent of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.NamedElement"></xref>.
NameReference should be identical to the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> attribute of the element to which the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.NamedElement> refers.
